item.title: A comparison of basal sliding and erosion in numerical glacial landscape evolution models using two different sliding laws
Climatic controls on glacial erosion â€“ insights from numerical glacial landscape evolution modeling
Spatial patterns of glacial erosion in mountains
item.description: Climate plays a significant role in controlling the evolution of alpine landscapes by influencing the rate and pattern of alpine glacier erosion. The equilibrium line altitude (ELA) is a common way to collapse climate into a single variable. The ELA is an integration of various factors controlling glacial mass balance and the position of the ELA is largely controlled by local temperature and snowfall rates. The location of the most rapid erosion is suggested to coincide with the intersection of the ELA and topography because the efficiency of glacial erosion is often assumed to be highest where the ice flux is at the maximum.
